metadata.feature_description: Reorder templates in hierarchy by dragging and dropping them to new positions

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Access Templates section and verify drag handle visibility

steps.action: Login as SuperUser and navigate to Manage > Templates
steps.expected: Templates section should load with a list of available page templates
steps.actual: Templates section UI loads but shows error: 'There was an error retrieving your content. Please check your internet connection.' Console logs show HTTP 500 Internal Server Error responses from the server API

issues: Server returns 500 Internal Server Error when fetching templates via GetPageTemplates API
Templates list is empty/not displayed due to backend error
Drag and drop functionality cannot be tested without visible templates

observations: The Templates UI at Manage > Templates loads successfully showing the 'Page Templates' header, search box, and 'Add Template' button
Code review confirms drag and drop is implemented via jQuery UI sortable/droppable in templatesHierarchy.js
The drag handle element (span.drag-area) should appear on each template item when templates are loaded
According to code, drag is disabled when search keyword is not empty (drag-area visibility bound to searchKeyword() == '')
The MovePage API is called to persist position changes after drag and drop
Backend API error (500) prevents templates from loading, blocking all drag and drop testing
